intro: Lepidomicrosorium hongchunpingense var. laceratum, commonly known as the Hongchunping lacerate fern, is a rare and endemic fern species found in specific regions of China. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that exhibit a unique lacerate or torn appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories, where it thrives in nutrient-rich, acidic soils. Its reproductive structures, including sporangia, are clustered on the undersides of the fronds, a common feature in many fern species. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
